intro: Cyrtandra neiothiantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and can reach heights of up to two meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
